overview:
Gino Goossens is an online strategist and specialized in E-Commerce, Governance, Business Architecture, Integration and Multi-Channel strategies. Since 1997 he has been working in the E-Commerce industry in various roles in Management, Consulting and Business Architectures with numerous responsibilities.

He has worked in the E-Commerce and retail industry for companies such as TUI Travel PLC, Elmar Travel, White Bread PLC, Quiksilver and IBM/Tivoli. Gino is known for his drive for result, his eagerness to learn and his ability to quickly understand the business needs and translate those into solid solutions. He believes in fast execution in a very focused way, he is thinking bold in decision-making and he focuses on impact. In September 2009 he joined Conrad Electronic as a Senior E-Commerce Strategist in the role as Chief E-Commerce & Innovation Officer and member of the International board of Directors. In this role Gino was responsible for the total E-Commerce turnover in 14 countries and for the IT, development and E-Commerce teams (54 people).

Gino Goossens has extensive experience working in international environment from various locations like Germany, Austria, France, Benelux, Czech, Hungary, Swiss, Sweden and United Kingdom (UK).

Some achievements:

> InterimMediair.nl (Sold 1994) > MonsterAmbition.com (1999 conflict with Monster.com and cancelled) > ITechGuardian.co.uk (Sold 2008 to The Guardian newspaper UK) > StateOfCloud (#1 Cloud Computing Technology Blog in The Netherlands) > Trip Essentials (Start-up Intelligent Travel & Serendipity service)

Companies he worked with/ for

> IBM/ Tivoli (Infrastructure Consultant) > Whitbread PLC (E-Commerce Manager) > Quiksilver (E-Commerce Specialist) > Camelbak hydration systems (E-Commerce Manager) > O’Neill (Interim) > Transavia.com (Interim) > Marktplaats.nl (Interim) > Elmar Online (Interim) > D-Reizen (Interim) > TUI Travel PLC (CTO) > Conrad Electronic SE (Chief E-Commerce & Innovation Officer) > GiMiScale // Smarter Clouds (CEO)

Specialities

> E-Commerce > Governance > Business Architecture > Multi-Channel (Store/On-line/Mobile/…) > On-line Marketing > E-Commerce in Europe > Cloud Computing Management
